instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2879 Green light no start no orange light
threads.message:
Im working on an really old 820-2879. No sign of water damage. Have green light but PPBUS_G3H
 starting at 6v and drops to about 1.5v. When battery connected its 12.8V and no drop but still no start and battery doesn't charge.

Dont have any working board of this old crap to compare to.

F7040 in diode mode shows 0.447V

threads.title: 820-2879 Green light no start no orange light
threads.message:
Check resistance to ground on L7220/60.
Same check at VREG3/5 on U7200.

threads.title: 820-2879 Green light no start no orange light
threads.message:
L7220 5.08 kohm
L7260 22.5 kohm

U7200 pin 8  dont get a value just counting up starting from 320 kohm
           pin 17 dont get a value just counting up

threads.title: 820-2879 Green light no start no orange light
threads.message:
Post resistance value between pins 17/18 and 27/28 on U7000.
Also post voltages at pins 2, 19, 20, 1, 26, 9, 15...

threads.title: 820-2879 Green light no start no orange light
threads.message:
Now Im back from holliday =) 

Resistance 17/18  3.2ohm
                   27/28  20.5ohm

voltage pin1 14.81v
             pin2 16.22
            pin19 5.15
            pin20 5.15
            pin21 0v
           pin26 15.74
           pin9 0.032v
           pin12 3.41

threads.title: 820-2879 Green light no start no orange light
threads.message: Problem around the TPS51125. Check for corrosion and damage. Check both coils for short to GND. If all good then replace the TPS.

threads.title: 820-2879 Green light no start no orange light
threads.message:
No sign of water damage,

R7220 was bad and changed. 

Diode mode
L7260 0.431v
L7220 0.124v

threads.title: 820-2879 Green light no start no orange light
820-2879 Green light no start no orange light
threads.message: Monitor PPBUS and plug in adapter, the voltage should spike up to 12.xV and then drop down. This indicates the ISL6259 is detecting an over current situation. But first need to know if the voltage comes up at all.

threads.title: 820-2879 Green light no start no orange light
threads.message: when I not touched the board for some time it will spike up to 12.4 and then drop down but now it just go up to 1.6v and then slowly down. Just have a multimeter to test with. It measures about 0.8V long time after disconnecting charger.

threads.title: 820-2879 Green light no start no orange light
threads.message: Connect a charged battery and AC power and see if 3V3_S5 is present from TPS51125.

threads.title: 820-2879 Green light no start no orange light
threads.message: lost the green light some how. not even plugged in the battery =) have to find out what missing

threads.title: 820-2879 Green light no start no orange light
threads.message: pp3V42? ACOK?

threads.title: 820-2879 Green light no start no orange light
threads.message: Ok now Im back and so are the green light =) NO 3V3_S5 with battery and AC power. PBUS not dropping with battery in place 12.6V. No orange light.

threads.title: 820-2879 Green light no start no orange light
threads.message:
measured u7200 with battery and ac power
1 0v
2 0v
3 2.0v
4 3.32v

6 0,725v

8 3.2v
9 4.5v

15 0v
16 12.59v
17 4.98v
18 0.062v
19 0v
20 0v
21 0v
22 4.51v
23 0v
24 0v

suddenly pp3v3_s5 was shorted to ground so tried to insert 3.3v to the rail. After a wile the short was gone and g3h was 12.6. Green and orange light when plugged in battery and ac. Tried to power on and fan spinned for one second. After this everything was back where I started with g3h dropping and no orange light. pp3v3_S5 only 0.063V and in diode mode 0.143V.

Another edit =) Changed U7200 once again and now g3h stable at 12.6 and battery charging. quarter fan spin. But pp3v3_s5 are 4.026V! Cant really understand what happening with this board =(

threads.title: 820-2879 Green light no start no orange light
threads.message: Looks like bad soldering on U7200 to me, or you are measuring 3V3_S5 at the wrong side of L7260.

threads.title: 820-2879 Green light no start no orange light
threads.message: shouldnt it be L7220? and I have 4.027V on both sides

threads.title: 820-2879 Green light no start no orange light
threads.message: Yeah L7220 sorry. 4V is no good and means either bad soldering on U7200 or dead U7200 or bad Q7220 or something corroded around U7200. If replacing anything replace U7200 and Q7220 at the same time.

threads.title: 820-2879 Green light no start no orange light
threads.message:
tryed change U7200 and Q7220 at the same time and still 4.02V =) Cant understand why.

threads.title: 820-2879 Green light no start no orange light
threads.message: Still seems like bad soldering or bad chip to me. Center pad soldered properly?

threads.title: 820-2879 Green light no start no orange light
threads.message:
After changing chip again and still 4v I started to measure all resistors around U7200. Find R7270 was a bit off value, changed and now I have a steady 3.3V =) Happy this is a board im working on when I have no other to do. Good training on soldering chips =)

Still no start. Have quarter spin so next problem to solve

threads.title: 820-2879 Green light no start no orange light
threads.message: All_SYS_PWRGD pulsing high when powering on? CPU Vcore pulsing too?

threads.title: 820-2879 Green light no start no orange light
threads.message:
Just have my multimeter to test with and 
All_SYS_PWRGD pulsing at start
PPVCORE_S0_CPU pulsing at start

threads.title: 820-2879 Green light no start no orange light
threads.message: Sorry for the bad news but I'm pretty sure the MCP will be the problem.

threads.title: 820-2879 Green light no start no orange light
threads.message: ok then its just continue with my other boards in the pile of shit boards =)
